intro: Hedyotis pinaster, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Hedyotis pinaster is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various purposes.
